channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What We Know About the Global Outage
item.description: Everything from airlines to banks to retailers were impacted in many countries.

item.title: Live Updates: Global Tech Outage Grounds Flights and Hits Businesses
item.description: Airlines, banks and broadcasters were among the companies around the world reporting disruptions, citing technical issues.

item.title: Amazon is cracking down on RTO holdouts and ‘speaking directly’ to employees who haven’t spent enough time in the office
item.description: Amazon is getting more serious about its return-to-office mandate—it’s now having one-on-one chats with employees who aren't spending enough "meaningful" time in the office.

item.title: A Border Crossing Shuttered for Months Traps the Sick and Wounded in Gaza
item.description: The Rafah crossing to Egypt has been closed since Israel captured it in early May, blocking the only route out of the territory for thousands of Palestinians who desperately need medical care.

item.title: Maps: 7.4-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Chile
item.description: View the location of the quake’s shake area and aftershocks.

item.title: Stellantis tells owners of over 24,000 Chrysler Pacifica hybrid minivans to park outside because the batteries can catch fire
item.description: The company said Thursday that it's recalling certain 2017 through 2021 Chrysler Pacifica plug-in hybrids, mainly in North America. Some are being recalled for a second time. All can still be driven.

item.title: The Bangladesh Protests, in Photos and Videos
item.description: Students, armed mainly with sticks, have been demonstrating for days against a quota system for government jobs they consider unfair. At least 17 people have died.

item.title: A Border Crossing Shuttered for Months Traps the Sick and Wounded in Gaza
item.description: The Rafah crossing to Egypt has been closed since Israel captured it in early May, blocking the only route out of the territory for thousands of Palestinians who desperately need medical care.

item.title: Donald Trump uses GOP nomination speech to urge Americans to heal ‘discord and division’ after assassination attempt
item.description: Trump’s address, the longest convention speech in modern history at just under 93 minutes, marked the climax and conclusion of a massive four-day Republican pep rally.

item.title: Microsoft Outage: What Caused the IT Meltdown
item.description: There have been two issues affecting Microsoft systems in quick succession, adding to the confusion over a global outage.

item.title: The Bangladesh Protests, in Photos and Videos
item.description: Students, armed mainly with sticks, have been demonstrating for days against a quota system for government jobs they consider unfair. At least 17 people have died.

item.title: Puerto Rico will get $325 million in federal funding to boost solar and battery storage projects as power outages persist
item.description: The program, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy, will target community centers and healthcare facilities, as well as common areas in subsidized, multi-family housing.

item.title: Global IT Outage Wreaks Havoc, and Trump Makes Divisive Speech
item.description: Plus, comedy legend Bob Newhart dies.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Houthis Claim Responsibility for Deadly Drone Attack in Tel Aviv
item.description: The drone crashed into a building near the U.S. consulate, killing at least one person. Israel’s military said the drone had likely come from Yemen, where the Houthis are based.

item.title: Tesla to power France’s biggest battery storage facility—boosting the nation’s capacity to store green electricity
item.description: U.K. developer Harmony Energy Ltd. has begun construction. The battery system will be fully operational by the end of next year.
